name: revengefully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you do something revengefully, you do it because you want revenge (= harm done to someone as a punishment for harm that they have done to someone): Someone had tripped him up and he jumped up, looking angrily and revengefully about him. She had never forgotten the wrong done to her and revengefully pursued those responsible.
More examplesFewer examplesThat was simply a revengefully unkind comment that won't help us move forward.It was to their credit that they governed consensually and not revengefully.He had nursed his anger revengefully for many years.
